intro: Cota segetalis, commonly known as the field cotta, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbel-shaped inflorescence. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows and along roadsides. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, aromatic scent. Cota segetalis is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
